page.title: 08Rousham Estate
page.content: The estate of 1100 acres is the same size now as it was in 1770. Like other estates in the area it grows cereal crops (as encouraged by the EEC farming policy), including wheat and winter barley, as well as beans, rape and, unusually, flax. The owner keeps beef cattle - Herefords, Charolais and Friesians - as well as his herd of long-horn cattle, now rare in England, which have been bred here since 1907. There is a continuing programme of tree planting, especially deciduous trees, to replace those lost to elm disease and recent storms. A lake has been made to the west of the Home Farm for reaons of conservation.
